text.english: Teorema: \(\texttt{mul}\) is correct (\(\texttt{mul}\) of two \(\mathcal{N}Term\) is equivalent to the product of the corresponding corrispondent numerical values of the two \(\mathcal{N}Term\)), i.e. \[ \forall n,m \in \mathcal{N}Term . \; \texttt{val}(\texttt{mul}(n,m)) = \texttt{val}(n) * \texttt{val}(m) \]
text.italiano: Teorema: \(\texttt{mul}\) Ã¨ corretta (\(\texttt{mul}\) di due \(\mathcal{N}Term\) equivale al prodotto dei corrispondenti valori numerici dei due \(\mathcal{N}Term\)), i.e. \[ \forall n,m \in \mathcal{N}Term . \; \texttt{val}(\texttt{mul}(n,m)) = \texttt{val}(n) * \texttt{val}(m) \]

theorem.coq: Theorem val_mul: forall n m : nterm , val (mul n m) = val n * val m.
